title: Public transport for the BBL cricket match Melbourne Stars v Hobart Hurricanes: Sunday 19 January 2025
articleContent:
It's time for a game of BBL cricket! Public transport is your best way to enjoy this, as the Melbourne Stars face off against Hobart Hurricanes to see who is going to qualify for the final series. Extra services will help you get to and from the MCG on Sunday 19 January.

The event will begin at 7.15pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Please note that there will be bus replacements running between:

    • Reservoir to Mernda, all day. Mernda passengers are advised to board Reservoir services from Jolimont (Platform 2), then transfer at Reservoir for a bus.
  •  
    • North Melbourne to Craigieburn, from 9pm. Craigieburn Passengers are to board any available service from Richmond (Platforms 1, 3, 5, 7 & 8), then change at Flinders Street for Northern Group services to North Melbourne.

Metro Trains Additional services 

Forward service to Jolimont Station 

  • Greensborough – leaving at 5:54pm

Forward service to Richmond Station 

  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 5:55pm
  • Sandringham – leaving at 6:05pm

Return service from Jolimont Station

  • Reservoir – leaving at 10:35pm from Platform 2
  • Greensborough – leaving at 10:42pm from Platform 2
  • Flinders Street – leaving at 10:43pm from Platform 1

Return service from Richmond Station 

  • Ringwood - leaving at 10:40pm and 11:04pm from Platform 9 
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10:57pm from Platform 10
  • Dandenong – leaving at 10:59pm from Platform 6
  • Frankston – leaving at 10:53pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 10:54pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the MCG 

Route 70 

  • Passengers can catch tram services alighting at stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.  

Route 75 

  • Passengers can catch tram services alighting at Stop 13 Wellington Parade/Simpson Street. 

 Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG: 

Route 246

  • Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

 Regional train

Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station
